intro: Achillea birjuczensis, commonly known as the Armenian yarrow, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring silver-gray, lance-shaped leaves and flat, clustered flower heads. Its flowers bloom in late summer, producing pale yellow to white petals. The plant is valued for its ornamental qualities and has been used traditionally in herbal medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory properties.
